intro: Tarenna truncatocalyx var. truncatocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tarenna, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a truncate base. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, black seeds.
